laravelEasyLocalizer.defaultLanguages.description: List of default language codes for which localization JSON files will be generated. Example: ["en", "it", "fr"]

laravelEasyLocalizer.excludePaths.description: Array of glob patterns or folder paths to exclude from the PHP source scan. Useful to skip vendor folders, tests, or custom directories.

laravelEasyLocalizer.excludeGitIgnorePat.description: If enabled, all paths and files listed in .gitignore will be excluded from the PHP source scan.

laravelEasyLocalizer.localizationPath.description: Defines the relative or absolute path to the directory where localization JSON files are stored. If set, this path will take priority over automatic detection. Leave empty to enable auto-detection based on Laravel conventions.

laravelEasyLocalizer.autoDetectLocalizat.description: Enables automatic detection of the localization directory if no manual path is set. It checks common Laravel paths like /lang and /resources/lang, and can propose creating the directory if not found.

laravelEasyLocalizer.disableCache.description: Disables the caching mechanism used by the extension. By default, the extension caches the content of scanned files to avoid re-scanning unchanged files. Enabling this option forces the extension to re-scan all files every time.

laravelEasyLocalizer.jsoncReferenceLangu.description: The language code to use as a reference when exporting to JSONC files. This language keys will be used as a base for all other language files, associating the list of source files of the labels as comments.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
